asked the Minister of Foreign Employment:
(a) Is she aware that a promise was given before the Presidential Election of the year 2010 to grant a pension to Rata Viruwo (Migrant Heroes) who have gone abroad for employment?
(b) If so, will she inform this House -
(i) the methodology followed for granting a pension to migrant heroes;
(ii) the manner in which contributions are made by the migrant heroes by the establishment at which they work and by the Government separately in providing migrant heroes with a pension;
(iii) the amount intended to be paid monthly as the pension; and
(iv) what other countries in the world pay a pension to those engaged in jobs overseas?
( ) ( () - ) (The Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorale - Minister of Foreign Employment) .
PERSONS KILLED BY WILD ELEPHANT ATTACKS :
asked the Minister of Tourism and Sports:
(a) Will he state, separately, in respect of each year from the year 2005 -2013 -
(i) the number of persons who were killed by wild elephant attacks within the Kurunegala District;
(ii) the number of wild elephants which were killed due to human activities in that district; and
(iii) the number of wild elephants which died in the whole Island?
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Navin Dissanayake - Minister of Tourism and Sports) .
( ) (The Hon. Navin Dissanayake) I am answering both Question Nos. 4783/'14 and 4784/14 together.
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) You cannot answer like that. Those two Questions have been asked separately. So, you have to answer them separately.
asked the Minister of Public Administration, Local Government and Democratic Governance:

(i) a proposal was made to Parliament through Budget 2015 for the confirmation of service of all those who have been recruited to the Public Service on temporary, casual (daily paid), substitution or contract basis and have completed a period of service of 180 days; and
(ii) the Public Administration Circular 25/2014 was issued with regard to the aforesaid confirmation of service?

(i) whether the phrase those who have completed a period of service of 180 days in (a) (i) above has been revised as those who have been in the Public Service for 07 years on casual basis in the interim Budget Proposals presented for the year 2015;
(ii) as to which proposal will be implemented out of the aforesaid two budget proposals; and
(iii) whether the labourers who are not confirmed in service as per the aforesaid proposals will be further deployed on casual basis as per the service requirement?
(c) If not, why? ( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Karu Jayasuriya - Minister of Public Administration, Local Government and Democratic Governance and Minister of Buddha Sasana) .
asked the Minister of Public Order and Christian Religious Affairs:

(a) Is he aware that a group of persons identifying themselves as election officials and a group of outsiders have entered the authorized election operations office at Mattikeli, Kandy Road, Trincomalee on 4th January, 2015 during the Presidential Election period and behaved violently and snatched away video equipment and office equipment?
(i) the inquiry made by the persons in the office at that time from the group of persons who entered the office will be considered a disturbance to the duty of the election officers;
(ii) display of information, screening of films, making speeches or carrying out other election propaganda activity even within authorized election offices during election time cannot be done;
(iii) the forcible entry and violent behaviour set out in the Code of Criminal Procedure are not applicable to election officers who behave in the manner mentioned in (a) above; and

(iv) what steps will be taken under good governance against the officers who behaved aggressively inside the aforesaid office, took away the office equipment and went on to file a case against those who ran that office?
(c) If not, why? ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. John Amaratunga - Minister of Public Order and Christian Religious Affairs) .
PART OF GOVERNMENT LAND IN WAGAWATTA, INGIRIYA:

(a) Is he aware that - (i) a part of a government land in the Wagawatta Grama Niladhari Division in the Ingiriya Divisional Secretary's Division has been obtained purportedly for a social service activity and has been used for a commercial waste recycle business by a private company; (ii) water of Mawak Oya from which the residents of the area satisfy their drinking water requirements has been polluted as a result of the activities of the above company in a land located in a catchment area; (iii) the Secretary of the then Ministry of Land and Land Development stated at the Consultative Committee Meeting of the Ministry of Land and Land Development held on 26th November, 2013 that action would be taken to reacquire the land, if action was not taken to return the land consequent to a request in writing to the relevant institution for the return of the said reservation; and
(iv) action has hitherto not been taken as stated above?
(b) Will he inform this House whether action will be taken to reacquire the above-mentioned land?
( ) (The Deputy Speaker) 9-5940/'15-(1) . ( ) (The Hon. Anura Dissanayake) . ( ) (The Hon. Gayantha Karunatileka) .
() ( () ) (The Hon. (Prof.) Rajiva Wijesinha) . ( ) (The Hon. Gayantha Karunatileka) .
LOSS OF HUMAN LIVES DUE TO WILD ELEPHANTS: ELECTRIC
() , ? asked the Minister of Tourism and Sports:
(i) the measures adopted for minimizing the loss of human lives in the island because of wild elephants;
(ii) whether an awareness exists regarding the overall length of electrical fencing (elephant fence) necessary for the whole island in order to be saved from wild elephants;
(iii) if so, how much is necessary;
(iv) what is the length of electrical fencing necessary for the Kurunegala District; and
(v) whether money has been allocated from this years Budget for erecting the electric fence?
(b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Navin Dissanayake ) .
() , ? asked the Minister of Internal Transport:

(i) Vehicles Lanka (Pvt.) Limited that has been registered under the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka, is currently engaged in a business of assembling and selling vehicles in Free Trade Zone and their customers are shown a letter that has been issued by the Commissioner General of Motor Traffic to the effect that the vehicles that are purchased from the aforesaid company will be registered within a period of one month;
(ii) but, however, the Department of Motor Traffic turns down the registration of vehicles sold by the aforesaid company; and
(iii) for that reason, a large number of buyers who have purchased motor vehicles from the aforesaid company have been inconvenienced a great deal, being unable to run their vehicles?
(b) Will he inform this House whether the facilities will be provided to register the vehicles that have been purchased from Vehicles Lanka (Pvt.) Limited, in the Department of Motor Traffic?
(c) If not, why? .. ( ) ( .. - ) (The Hon. R.M. Ranjith Madduma Bandara - Minister of Internal Transport) :

LOANS GRANTED BY BANKS TO GOVERNMENT: DETAILS
() , ? asked the Prime Minister and Minister of Policy Planning, Economic Affairs, Child, Youth and Cultural Affairs:
(a) Will he state the total number of accredited banks in Sri Lanka?
(i) separately, the amount of assets in each of the said banks; and
(ii) the amount of credit granted by each of the said banks to the Government?
(c) Will he inform this House whether there is a system to recover the loans granted by the said banks to the Government?
() ( ) ( () - , , , ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Harsha De Silva - Deputy Minister of Policy Planning, Economic Affairs, Child, Youth and Cultural Affairs)
: LUXURY VEHICLES OBTAINED BY AIR FORCE ON HIRE :
(i) the air-conditioned luxury vehicles obtained by the Air Force on hire basis are used by the senior officers of the Air Force for their private use; and
(ii) fuel for the said vehicles is obtained from the Government?
(i) whether Sri Lanka Air Force and the Ministry of Defence have consented to the use of air- conditioned luxury vehicles obtained on hire basis for private use of the senior officers;
(ii) if not, whether an inquiry has been held regarding such use of vehicles; and

/ : POLICE OFFICERS / CATEGORIES NOT ENTITLED TO SPECIAL
asked the Minister of Public Order and Christian Religious Affairs:

(i) whether there are categories of police officers or officers who are not subjected to Increase of allowances to Police officers 2013 under IGP Circular 2416/2013 and Establishments Circular 01/2013;
(ii) if so, such categories of police officers or officers;
(iii) the reason for not increasing the allowances of that category of officers as per the above circulars?
(b) Will he state whether those engaged in the Sri Lanka Police Engineering Service do not come under the category of police officers?
) ( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Arundika Fernando) - (1):

(a) Will he state - (i) the number of prisoners in prisons who have been sentenced to death at present; (ii) the number of prisoners in prisons who have been sentenced to life at present; (iii) the date the penalty imposed on prisoners sentenced to death and prisoners sentenced to life was last commuted, taking their good conduct into account; and (iv) if such penalties have not been commuted, whether steps will be taken to do so? (b) If not, why?
() ( ) ( () - ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe - Minister of Justice) * .
) ( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Indika Bandaranayake) - (1) :
asked the Minister of Highways and Investment Promotion:

(i) road development projects of Phase II of Mawiela-Kirimetiyawa Road in Panduwasnuwara East Divisional Secretary's Division, Phase II of Nikatapitiya-Ihalagama Road in Panduwasnuwara West Divisional
Secretary's Division and Wadumunna-Madana Road including carpeting of those roads were commenced after allocations had been approved and contracts had been signed;
(ii) the development activities of the aforesaid roads have suddenly been suspended by now; and
(iii) that the transportation activities on the aforesaid roads, which are in a severely dilapidated state, have become extremely difficult?
(b) Will he inform this House of -
(i) the reasons that led to the sudden stoppage of the development activities of the above-mentioned roads; and
(ii) the date on which the development activities of the aforesaid roads will be resumed?
(c) If not, why? ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Eran Wickramaratne - Deputy Minister of Highways and Investment Promotion) * .

( ) (Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees) The next speaker is the Hon. Ajith Mannapperuma. Hon. Members, please try to finish your speech in five minutes because we have to take up another Vote of Condolence.
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Felix Perera - Minister of Special Projects) . " " . " ". " " . . " " . "" .

[5.45 p.m.] ( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem - Minister of Urban Development, Water Supply and Drainage) Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees, the late Hon. Athula Nimalasiri Jayasinghe entered Parliament the same year as I did, way back in 1994. I remember Athula as an exceptional personality for many reasons. I mean to say this because he had a background, as many in this House have testified, having taken part in the insurrection in 1971. His militant qualities were not something that we could see from him when he came to this House. We have a practice of having had many such militants entering the democratic mainstream and taking part in politics including yourself, Hon. Deputy Chairman of Committees.

So, with this background, he was somebody from whom I could, at many casual discussions, understand the ideology behind the uprising in 1971. He was somebody who was not that inclined to accept the subsequent second uprising in 1989, because by then he had joined the Sri Lanka Freedom Party or, moreover, he joined the Sri Lanka Mahajana Party which was formed by the late Vijaya Kumaratunga, the husband of our former President, Mrs. Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga.

We are aware of his contribution to the politics of the Gampaha District and the way in which he functioned within those periods when the Sri Lanka Freedom Party boycotted the 1988 Provincial Council Elections. The late Vijaya Kumaratunga very courageously came forward to contest that Election because it left a big vacuum for left-of-centre politics. The United National Party would not have been sufficiently challenged if not for parties like the Sri Lanka Mahajana Party, which took on the challenge in filling that void, which was left by the

boycott of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party through which they made another big contribution towards devolution in this country, because now, the Sri Lanka Freedom Party and many other parties which originally boycotted the Provincial Council system have come a full circle and now accepted the need for devolution in the country. But, people like Athula Nimalasiri Jayasinghe took a big risk in coming forward because his leader, Vijaya Kumaratunga was assassinated, and subsequently Ossie Abeyagunasekera, who stepped into those issues was also assassinated. In spite of all those incidents, he was a very courageous personality along with many of his comrades to have come forward, particularly to give encouragement to pro-devolution forces, to contest in 1988.

Then, in 1993, he was re-elected to the same Provincial Council, but in 1994, under Mrs. Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga, he contested the Parliamentary Election and entered Parliament from the Gampaha District and continued to represent Parliament up to 2004. For 10 long years, he had served this House in two deputy ministerial positions and he was someone who would very rarely display his militant qualities within the Chamber of this House. He was a very calm and soft-spoken personality who had always enriched the debates in this House.

Therefore, it is the duty of the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress to pay tribute to someone who had, through his transmogrification in his career, from a militant to a democratic politician, contributed immensely to the political culture of this country. I pay my tribute to him and also would like to extend my condolences to his wife, children, and family members as well as all his comrades on this occasion when we are taking up his Vote of Condolence.
Thank you very much. [.. 5.50 ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Lasantha Alagiyawanna - Deputy Minister of Rural Economic Affairs) . . . . .
[.. 5.58 () ( ) ( ( ) - ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne - Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine) . .

() ( ( ) ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne) I will wind up, Sir.

( ) (Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees) I wish to associate myself with the sentiments expressed by both sides of Parliament on the death of the Hon. Athula Nimalasiri Jayasinghe Wijayamunideva, ex-Member of Parliament. I shall direct the Secretary-General of Parliament to send a copy of the Official Report, Hansard, to the members of the bereaved family.

PROBLEMS ARISEN AT CARDIOLOGY UNIT OF KARAPITIYA
( ) (Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees) Order, please! Will an Hon. Member propose the Hon. Perumal Rajathurai to take the Chair?
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) I propose that the Hon. Perumal Rajathurai do now take the Chair.
Whereupon MR. DEPUTY CHAIRMAN OF COMMITTEES left the Chair and THE HON. PERUMAL RAJATHURAI took the Chair.
[.. 6.53 ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Gayantha Karunatileka - Minister of Mass Media and Chief Government Whip) . . . . . . . . .
[.. 7.03 () ( ) ( ( ) - ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne - Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine) . . Dr. Namal Gamage . . " . . '' . . . .
" thoracic surgeon . " . " " . . . Dr. Bhagya Piyasiri, Consultant Microbiologist report . report 25 . report .

I quote: Re: Cardiothoracic unit, TH Karapitiya In response to your request made as instructed by the DGHS regarding cardiothoracic surgeries, I would like to highlight my observations and suggestions:
1. A lot of cardiothoracic units in the world share the same theatres for both cardiac and thoracic surgeries.."
"2. There is no statistical evidence to state that wound infection rate following cardiac surgeries has increased
following introduction of thoracic surgeries in the same theatre complex.
3. There was no official request to the infection control team for opinion on a recent rise in post-cardiac surgery infection rates.
4. It is recommended for all wards in the CTU to have regular mortality and morbidity meetings with consultant anaesthetist and the consultant microbiologist.
5. It is recommended that audits and active surveillance on post-op infection rates to be carried out with the help of infection control team in order to identify outbreaks and early intervention.
6. Proper and thorough cleaning should be carried out according to the theatre standards especially after surgery on an infected patient.
Further, the department of microbiology and infection control and prevention is willing to provide its best service in order to help CTU to function without any interruption.
